text: Paul and Timothy the servants of JESUS CHRIST, to all the Saints in Christ Jesus, which are at Philippi, with the Bishops, and Deacons:
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace be with you, and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ:
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank my God, having you in perfect memory,
speaker: Narrator

text: (Always in all my prayers for all you, praying with gladness)
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of the fellowship which ye have in the Gospel, from the first day unto now.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I am persuaded of this same thing, that he that hath begun this good work in you, will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: As it becometh me so to judge of you all, because I have you in remembrance, that both in my bands, and in my defense, and confirmation of the Gospel you all were partakers of my grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is my record, how I long after you all from the very heart root in Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this I pray that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge, and in all judgment,
speaker: Narrator

text: That ye may allow those things which are best, that ye may be pure, and without offense, until the day of Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: Filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ unto the glory and praise of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I would ye understood, brethren, that the things which have come unto me, are turned rather to the furthering of the Gospel,
speaker: Narrator

text: So that my bands in Christ are famous throughout all the judgment hall, and in all other places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Insomuch that many of the brethren in the Lord are boldened through my bands, and dare more frankly speak the Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some preach Christ even through envy and strife, and some also of good will.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one part preacheth Christ of contention, and not purely, supposing to add more affliction to my bands.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the others of love, knowing that I am set for the defense of the Gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: What then: yet Christ is preached all manner ways, whether it be under a pretence, or sincerely: and I therein joy: yea, and will joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know that this shall turn to my salvation through your prayer, and by the help of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: As I fervently look for, and hope, that in nothing I shall be ashamed, but that with all confidence, as always, so now Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether it be by life or by death.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Christ is to me both in life and in death advantage.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whether to live in the flesh were profitable for me, and what to choose I know not.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am distressed between both, desiring to be loosed and to be with Christ, which is best of all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, to abide in the flesh, is more needful for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this am I sure of, that I shall abide, and with you all continue, for your furtherance and joy of your faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: That ye may more abundantly rejoice in JESUS CHRIST for me, by my coming to you again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only let your conversation be as it becometh the Gospel of Christ, that whether I come and see you, or else be absent, I may hear of your matters, that ye continue in one spirit, and in one mind, fighting together through the faith of the Gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in nothing fear your adversaries, which is to them a token of perdition, and to you of salvation, and that of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For unto you it is given for Christ, that not only ye should believe in him, but also suffer for his sake,
speaker: Narrator

text: Having the same fight, which ye saw in me, and now hear to be in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any compassion and mercy,
speaker: Narrator

text: Fulfill my joy, that ye be like minded, having the same love, being of one accord, and of one judgment,
speaker: Narrator

text: That nothing be done through contention or vainglory, but that in meekness of mind every man esteem others better than himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of other men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the same mind be in you that was even in Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who being in the form of God, thought it no robbery to be equal with God:
speaker: Narrator

text: But he made himself of no reputation, and took on him the form of a servant, and was made like unto men, and was found in shape as a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: He humbled himself, and became obedient unto the death, even the death of the cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore God hath also highly exalted him, and given him a name above every name.
speaker: Narrator

text: That at the Name of Jesus should every knee bow, both of things in heaven, and things in earth, and things under the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is the Lord, unto the glory of God the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore my beloved, as ye have always obeyed me, not as in my presence only, but now much more in mine absence, so make an end of your own salvation with fear and trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is God which worketh in you both the will and the deed, even of his good pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do all things without murmuring and reasonings,
speaker: Narrator

text: That ye may be blameless, and pure, and the sons of God without rebuke in the midst of a naughty and crooked nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world,
speaker: Narrator

text: Holding forth the word of life, that I may rejoice in the day of Christ, that I have not run in vain, neither have labored in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, and though I be offered up upon the sacrifice, and service of your faith, I am glad, and rejoice with you all.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the same cause also be ye glad, and rejoice with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I trust in the Lord Jesus, to send Timothy shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have no man like-minded, who will faithfully care for your matters.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all seek their own, and not that which is Jesus Christ’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye know the proof of him, that as a son with the father, he hath served with me in the Gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Him therefore I hope to send as soon as I know how it will go with me,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I trust in the Lord, that I also myself shall come shortly.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I supposed it necessary to send my brother Epaphroditus unto you my companion in labor, and fellow soldier, even your messenger, and he that ministered unto me such things as I wanted.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he longed after all you, and was full of heaviness, because ye had heard that he had been sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: And no doubt he was sick, very near unto death: but God had mercy on him, and not on him only, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent him therefore the more diligently, that when ye should see him again, ye might rejoice, and I might be the less sorrowful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness, and make much of such:
speaker: Narrator

text: Because that for the work of Christ he was near unto death, and regarded not his life, to fulfill that service which was lacking on your part toward me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, my brethren, rejoice in the Lord. It grieveth me not to write the same things to you, and for you it is a sure thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware of dogs: beware of evil workers: beware of the concision.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are the circumcision, which worship God in the spirit, and rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh:
speaker: Narrator

text: Though I might also have confidence in the flesh. If any other man thinketh that he hath whereof he might trust in the flesh, much more I,
speaker: Narrator

text: Circumcised the eighth day, of the kindred of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, an Hebrew of the Hebrews, by the Law a Pharisee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning zeal, I persecuted the Church: touching the righteousness which is in the Law, I was unrebukeable.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the things that were vantage unto me, the same I counted loss for Christ’s sake.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, doubtless I think all things but loss for the excellent knowledge sake of Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have counted all things loss, and do judge them to be dung, that I might win Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: And might be found in him, that is, not having mine own righteousness, which is of the Law, but that which is through the faith of Christ, even the righteousness which is of God through faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: That I may know him, and the virtue of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his afflictions, and be made conformable unto his death,
speaker: Narrator

text: If by any means I might attain unto the resurrection of the dead:
speaker: Narrator

text: Not as though I had already attained to it, either were already perfect: but I follow, if that I may comprehend that for whose sake also I am comprehended of Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brethren, I count not myself, that I have attained to it, but one thing I do: I forget that which is behind, and endeavor myself unto that which is before,
speaker: Narrator

text: And follow hard toward the mark, for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us therefore as many as be perfect, be thus minded: and if ye be otherwise minded, God shall reveal even the same unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, in that whereunto we are come, let us proceed by one rule, that we may mind one thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brethren, be followers of me, and look on them, which walk so, as ye have us for an example.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many walk, of whom I have told you often, and now tell you weeping, that they are the enemies of the cross of Christ:
speaker: Narrator

text: Whose end is damnation, whose God is their belly, and whose glory is to their shame, which mind earthly things.
speaker: Narrator

text: But our conversation is in heaven, from whence also we look for the Savior, even the Lord Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who shall change our vile body, that it may be fashioned like unto his glorious body, according to the working, whereby he is able even to subdue all things unto himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, my brethren, beloved and longed for, my joy and my crown, so continue in the Lord, ye beloved.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray Euodia, and beseech Syntyche, that they be of one accord in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, and I beseech thee, faithful yokefellow, help those women, which labored with me in the Gospel, with Clement also, and with other my fellow laborers, whose names are in the book of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice in the Lord always, again I say, rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let your patient mind be known unto all men. The Lord is at hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be nothing careful, but in all things let your requests be showed unto God in prayer and supplication with giving of thanks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the peace of God which passeth all understanding, shall preserve your hearts and minds in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things are honest, whatsoever things are just, whatsoever things are pure, whatsoever things are worthy love, whatsoever things are of good report, if there be any virtue, or if there be any praise, think on these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which ye have both learned and received, and heard, and seen in me: those things do, and the God of peace shall be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I rejoice also in the Lord greatly, that now at the last your care for me springeth afresh, wherein notwithstanding ye were careful, but ye lacked opportunity.
speaker: Narrator

text: I speak not because of want: for I have learned in whatsoever state I am, therewith to be content.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I can be abased, and I can abound: everywhere in all things I am instructed, both to be full, and to be hungry, and to abound, and to have want.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am able to do all things through the help of Christ, which strengtheneth me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding ye have well done, that ye did communicate to mine affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye Philippians know also that in the beginning of the Gospel, when I departed from Macedonia, no Church communicated with me, concerning the matter of giving and receiving, but ye only.
speaker: Narrator

text: For even when I was in Thessalonica, ye sent once, and afterward again for my necessity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that I desire a gift: but I desire the fruit which may further your reckoning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I have received all, and have plenty: I was even filled, after that I had received of Epaphroditus that which came from you, an odor that smelleth sweet, a sacrifice acceptable and pleasant to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my God shall fulfill all your necessities through his riches with glory in Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto God even our Father be praise for evermore, Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salute all the Saints in Christ Jesus. The brethren, which are with me, greet you.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the Saints salute you, and most of all they which are of Caesar’s household.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all, Amen.
¶Written to the Philippians from Rome, and sent by Epaphroditus.
speaker: Narrator
